alert.note: Alert for Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 12:33AM CDT until April 29 at 11:48AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Burnet, Travis and Williamson. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1231 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated only patches of light rain. However, earlier heavy rains up to 2 inches will continue urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Round Rock, Cedar Park, Georgetown, Serenada, Leander, Lago Vista, Liberty Hill, Jarrell, Florence, Andice, Georgetown Dam, Sun City, Smithwick, Spicewood, Jonestown, Seward Junction and Theon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
